entry.title: one of Piet Mondrian's paintings (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after one of Piet Mondrian's paintings (shown) was discovered to have been hanging upside down for decades, the museum left it as is?

entry.title: Charles III (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Charles III abdicated to become a monk, leaving his land divided between his younger brothers?

entry.title: an artist (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an artist tried to fly on a Hummingbird?

entry.title: Loophonium (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Loophonium, a cross between a euphonium and a toilet, was played alongside the Royal Liverpool Philharmonic on April Fools' Day?

entry.title: Edith of Wilton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Edith of Wilton was criticized for not working after her death?

entry.title: Twelves (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Twelves, a pet monkey, died and became a diamond?

entry.title: 'average person eats 3 spiders a year' factoid actualy just statistical error (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that "'average person eats 3 spiders a year' factoid actualy just statistical error"?

entry.title: a rabbit (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a rabbit played for the Philadelphia Eagles – as there's a drive into deep left field by Castellanos, that will be a home run. And so that will make it a 4–0 ballgame?
